005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.ISequence;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.IItem;
010
011import java.util.ArrayList;
012import java.util.Collections;
013import java.util.HashMap;
014import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
015import java.util.List;
016import java.util.Map;
017import java.util.Objects;
018import java.util.Set;
019import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
020import java.util.function.BinaryOperator;
021import java.util.function.Function;
022import java.util.function.Supplier;
023import java.util.stream.Collector;
024import java.util.stream.Collectors;
025import java.util.stream.Stream;
026
027import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
028
029/**
030 * A variety of collector and other stream utilities.
031 */
032@SuppressWarnings("PMD.CouplingBetweenObjects")
033public final class CustomCollectors {
034  /**
035   * An implementation of {@link Function#identity()} that respects non-nullness.
036   *
037   * @param <T>
038   *          the Java type of the identity object
039   * @return the identity function
040   */
041  @SuppressWarnings("null")
042  @NonNull
043  public static <T> Function<T, T> identity() {
044    return Function.identity();
045  }
046
047  /**
048   * Joins a sequence of string values using oxford-style serial commas.
049   *
050   * @param conjunction
051   *          the conjunction to use after the penultimate comma (e.g., and, or)
052   * @return a collector that will perform the joining
053   */
054  public static Collector<CharSequence, ?, String> joiningWithOxfordComma(@NonNull String conjunction) {
055    return Collectors.collectingAndThen(Collectors.toList(), withOxfordComma(conjunction));
056  }
057
058  private static Function<List<CharSequence>, String> withOxfordComma(@NonNull String conjunction) {
059    return list -> {
060      int size = list.size();
061      if (size < 2) {
062        return String.join("", list);
063      }
064      if (size == 2) {
065        return String.join(" " + conjunction + " ", list);
066      }
067      // else there are 3 or more
068      int last = size - 1;
069      return String.join(", " + conjunction + " ",
070          String.join(", ", list.subList(0, last)),
071          list.get(last));
072    };
073  }
074
075  /**
076   * Produce a new stream with duplicates removed based on the provided
077   * {@code keyMapper}. When a duplicate key is encountered, the second item is
078   * used. The original sequencing is preserved if the input stream is sequential.
079   *
080   * @param <V>
081   *          the item value for the streams
082   * @param <K>
083   *          the key type
084   * @param stream
085   *          the stream to reduce
086   * @param keyMapper
087   *          the key function to use to find unique items
088   * @return a new stream
089   */
090  public static <V, K> Stream<V> distinctByKey(
091      @NonNull Stream<V> stream,
092      @NonNull Function<? super V, ? extends K> keyMapper) {
093    return distinctByKey(stream, keyMapper, (key, value1, value2) -> value2);
094  }
095
096  /**
097   * Produce a new stream with duplicates removed based on the provided
098   * {@code keyMapper}. When a duplicate key is encountered, the provided
099   * {@code duplicateHandler} is used to determine which item to keep. The
100   * original sequencing is preserved if the input stream is sequential.
101   *
102   * @param <V>
103   *          the item value for the streams
104   * @param <K>
105   *          the key type
106   * @param stream
107   *          the stream to reduce
108   * @param keyMapper
109   *          the key function to use to find unique items
110   * @param duplicateHander
111   *          used to determine which of two duplicates to keep
112   * @return a new stream
113   */
114  public static <V, K> Stream<V> distinctByKey(
115      @NonNull Stream<V> stream,
116      @NonNull Function<? super V, ? extends K> keyMapper,
117      @NonNull DuplicateHandler<K, V> duplicateHander) {
118    Map<K, V> uniqueRoles = stream
119        .collect(toMap(
120            keyMapper,
121            identity(),
122            duplicateHander,
123            LinkedHashMap::new));
124    return uniqueRoles.values().stream();
125  }
126
127  /**
128   * Produces a map collector that uses the provided key and value mappers, and a
129   * duplicate hander to manage duplicate key insertion.
130   *
131   * @param <T>
132   *          the item Java type
133   * @param <K>
134   *          the map key Java type
135   * @param <V>
136   *          the map value Java type
137   * @param keyMapper
138   *          the function used to produce the map's key based on the provided
139   *          item
140   * @param valueMapper
141   *          the function used to produce the map's value based on the provided
142   *          item
143   * @param duplicateHander
144   *          the handler used to manage duplicate key insertion
145   * @return the collector
146   */
147  @NonNull
148  public static <T, K, V> Collector<T, ?, Map<K, V>> toMap(
149      @NonNull Function<? super T, ? extends K> keyMapper,
150      @NonNull Function<? super T, ? extends V> valueMapper,
151      @NonNull DuplicateHandler<K, V> duplicateHander) {
152    return toMap(keyMapper, valueMapper, duplicateHander, HashMap::new);
153  }
154
155  /**
156   * Produces a map collector that uses the provided key and value mappers, and a
157   * duplicate hander to manage duplicate key insertion.
158   *
159   * @param <T>
160   *          the item Java type
161   * @param <K>
162   *          the map key Java type
163   * @param <V>
164   *          the map value Java type
165   * @param <M>
166   *          the Java type of the resulting map
167   * @param keyMapper
168   *          the function used to produce the map's key based on the provided
169   *          item
170   * @param valueMapper
171   *          the function used to produce the map's value based on the provided
172   *          item
173   * @param duplicateHander
174   *          the handler used to manage duplicate key insertion
175   * @param supplier
176   *          the supplier used to create the resulting map
177   * @return the collector
178   */
179  @NonNull
180  public static <T, K, V, M extends Map<K, V>> Collector<T, ?, M> toMap(
181      @NonNull Function<? super T, ? extends K> keyMapper,
182      @NonNull Function<? super T, ? extends V> valueMapper,
183      @NonNull DuplicateHandler<K, V> duplicateHander,
184      Supplier<M> supplier) {
185    return ObjectUtils.notNull(
186        Collector.of(
187            supplier,
188            (map, item) -> {
189              K key = keyMapper.apply(item);
190              V value = Objects.requireNonNull(valueMapper.apply(item));
191              V oldValue = map.get(key);
192              if (oldValue != null) {
193                value = duplicateHander.handle(key, oldValue, value);
194              }
195              map.put(key, value);
196            },
197            (map1, map2) -> {
198              map2.forEach((key, value) -> {
199                V oldValue = map1.get(key);
200                V newValue = value;
201                if (oldValue != null) {
202                  newValue = duplicateHander.handle(key, oldValue, value);
203                }
204                map1.put(key, newValue);
205              });
206              return map1;
207            }));
208  }
209
210  /**
211   * A handler that supports resolving duplicate keys while inserting values into
212   * a map.
213   *
214   * @param <K>
215   *          the Java type of the map's keys
216   * @param <V>
217   *          the Java type of the map's values
218   */
219  @FunctionalInterface
220  public interface DuplicateHandler<K, V> {
221    /**
222     * The handler callback.
223     *
224     * @param key
225     *          the duplicate key
226     * @param value1
227     *          the first value associated with the key
228     * @param value2
229     *          the second value associated with the key
230     * @return the value to insert into the map
231     */
232    @NonNull
233    V handle(K key, @NonNull V value1, V value2);
234  }
235
236  /**
237   * A binary operator that will always use the first of two values.
238   *
239   * @param <T>
240   *          the item type
241   * @return the operator
242   */
243  @NonNull
244  public static <T> BinaryOperator<T> useFirstMapper() {
245    return (value1, value2) -> value1;
246  }
247
248  /**
249   * A binary operator that will always use the second of two values.
250   *
251   * @param <T>
252   *          the item type
253   * @return the operator
254   */
255  @NonNull
256  public static <T> BinaryOperator<T> useLastMapper() {
257    return (value1, value2) -> value2;
258  }
259
260  /**
261   * A {@link Collector} implementation to generates a sequence from a stream of
262   * Metapath items.
263   *
264   * @param <ITEM_TYPE>
265   *          the Java type of the items
266   * @return a collector that will generate a sequence
267   */
268  @NonNull
269  public static <ITEM_TYPE extends IItem> Collector<ITEM_TYPE, ?, ISequence<ITEM_TYPE>> toSequence() {
270    return new Collector<ITEM_TYPE, List<ITEM_TYPE>, ISequence<ITEM_TYPE>>() {
271
272      @Override
273      public Supplier<List<ITEM_TYPE>> supplier() {
274        return ObjectUtils.notNull(ArrayList::new);
275      }
276
277      @Override
278      public BiConsumer<List<ITEM_TYPE>, ITEM_TYPE> accumulator() {
279        return List::add;
280      }
281
282      @Override
283      public BinaryOperator<List<ITEM_TYPE>> combiner() {
284        return (list1, list2) -> {
285          list1.addAll(list2);
286          return list1;
287        };
288      }
289
290      @Override
291      public Function<List<ITEM_TYPE>, ISequence<ITEM_TYPE>> finisher() {
292        return list -> ISequence.ofCollection(ObjectUtils.notNull(list));
293      }
294
295      @Override
296      public Set<Characteristics> characteristics() {
297        return Collections.emptySet();
298      }
299    };
300  }
301
302  private CustomCollectors() {
303    // disable construction
304  }
305}
